item.title: When to Model Things
item.description: Why use models? One of the most fascinating things I have dealt with in the world is dealing with people who fundamentally are skeptical of using models for things because they’re not “100% true”. It’s an interesting premise because it shows such a profoundly ignorant understanding of epistemology. All models are false, but some are useful since they’re approximations of the truth. One good example is “cows are spheres” is a good model for certain physics problems because it is easier than dealing with the complexity of an actual cow and is approximately correct.
